comment.author: 15558406@N03
comment._content: The conical portion of the parliament buildings (i.e., the portion furthest to the right) is the parliamentary library.  It is the only original portion of the building still standing.  The rest of the building was destroyed by fire on February 2, 1916, and was replaced by a newer structure completed in 1928.

comment.author: 35607158@N06
comment._content: In the foreground is the entrance to the Rideau Canal

comment.author: 43661283@N00
comment._content: Really hasn't changed all that much.

comment.author: 55231144@N03
comment._content:
Awesome shot!!!  Glad I found a FREE version of it for the book I'm working on.  Some person on ebay is selling it for upwards to 20$ for a print out version, or 75$ for a digital version claiming they scanned it in themselves.  Looks a lot like this one in quality.  hmmmmm.

And Yes, not much has changed since then.  That little building with the red roof was the former "Parliament Pumphouse".  Its long gone, but its complete foundation AND mini tunnel remain and its quite cool to look at and take photos of.  Just a lost piece of the city that was.  When Parliament was rebuilt in 1916, the plans called for the pumphouse to be moved next to where the supreme court stands and to have everything route that way instead.  That one is still there now.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Thank you cjuneau, jamica1, m. gifford and mikemacjunkie1 for adding more information about the buildings to this image.  We will add some of them to the image description when we update.
